name: places/ChIJL2ytnJZZwokRJXPraq16tWU
formattedAddress: 33 Greenwich Ave, New York, NY 10014, USA
adrFormatAddress: 33 Greenwich Ave, New York, NY 10014, USA

originalText.text:
Stay away.
Dropped off a jacket, went to pick it up and it was nearly the same condition!

I was very kind and asked him to fix it and the owner got in my face, YELLING and being inexcusable rude. He tried to keep my jacket and force me out. Was forced to pay. Do not recommend!

originalText.text: By far the best dry cleaning/tailoring services in NYC. The owner, James, is such a nice fellow. He truly cares about his customers. When it comes to tailoring he is an absolute pro. My suits have never looked so good. If you have expensive designer clothing don’t risk taking it somewhere else. This is your place.

My suits have never looked so good. If you have expensive designer clothing don’t risk taking it somewhere else. This is your place.

originalText.text: Always come here to get patches sewed  into my hat for very cheap price and good quality

text.text: Always come here to get patches sewed  into my hat for very cheap price and good quality

originalText.text: This place is extremely unprofessional, I would strongly recommend not to use their service ever. I lost 2 pairs of clothes here - when i called to ask about what happened they told me "it is not their responsibility." I am confused as who else's responsibility it would be? Two times I tried to reason with the owner, and both times he told me it wasn't his responsibility. Did not offer any concession. Further, his hours say 7-7:30 but when I would call at 6:15pm he told me it was too late. This was a common occurrence. Lastly, my friend who had used his service for over a year lost all of his dress shirts. When my friend went to the store to ask what happened, he was told he did not have them numerous times. My friend noticed his shirts on the wall, checked them, and realized they were his and took them back (while the owner insisted they were not). If you don't like your clothes lost, terrible customer service, and unfriendly owner, I would not use this service.

originalText.text:
Not sure what these bad reviews are about.

Theory sent me to them to fix some pants. I've been going since. They've hemmed other pants, sewn on buttons onto shirts, coats, and pants-- all very well.

Also this place is always mobbed -- it's pretty clear it has a lot of happy customers.
